## Name

tail

## Synopsis

```*sh
$ tail [--follow] [--lines number] [file]
```

## Description

Print the end ('tail') of a file. If no file is specified, or the filename '-' is specified, it defaults to standard input.

## Options:

* `-f`, `--follow`: Output data as it is written to the file
* `-n number`, `--lines number`: Fetch the specified number of lines

## Arguments:

* `file`: File path
